intro: Polyactium uitenhagense, commonly known as the Uitenhage polyactium, is a rare and endemic species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
